snippet: A judge’s ruling means the suit by a man wrongfully convicted of murder could require Charles J. Hynes, the Brooklyn district attorney, to defend his policies in the middle of a re-election campaign.
abstract: Judge Frederic Block of United States District Court in Brooklyn rules that lawsuit by Jabbar Collins against Brooklyn District Attorney Charles J Hynes and New York Police Dept can proceed, setting stage for trial in which Hynes may be called to testify in defense of his policies amid heated re-election campaign; Collins served 16 years in prison after wrongful murder conviction and is seeking $150 million in damages.
lead_paragraph: A judge’s ruling means the suit by a man wrongfully convicted of murder could require Charles J. Hynes, the Brooklyn district attorney, to defend his policies in the middle of a re-election campaign.

headline.seo: Lawsuit Against Charles J. Hynes, Brooklyn District Attorney, Is Allowed to Proceed
